1.text: And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—

2.text: Doth a wise man answer with vain knowledge? And fill with an east wind his belly?

3.text: To reason with a word not useful? And speeches—no profit in them?

4.text: Yea, thou dost make reverence void, And dost diminish meditation before God.

5.text: For thy mouth teacheth thine iniquity, And thou chooseth the tongue of the subtile.

6.text: Thy mouth declareth thee wicked, and not I, And thy lips testify against thee.

7.text: The first man art thou born? And before the heights wast thou formed?

8.text: Of the secret counsel of God dost thou hear? And withdrawest thou unto thee wisdom?

9.text: What hast thou known, and we know not? Understandest thou—and it is not with us?

10.text: Both the gray-headed And the very aged are among us—Greater than thy father in days.

11.text: Too few for thee are the comforts of God? And a gentle word is with thee,

12.text: What—doth thine heart take thee away? And what—are thine eyes high?

13.text: For thou turnest against God thy spirit? And hast brought out words from thy mouth:

14.text: What is man that he is pure, And that he is righteous, one born of woman?

15.text: Lo, in His holy ones He putteth no credence, And the heavens have not been pure in His eyes.

16.text: Also—surely abominable and filthy Is man drinking as water perverseness.

17.text: I shew thee—hearken to me—And this I have seen and declare:

18.text: Which the wise declare—And have not hid—from their fathers.

19.text: To them alone was the land given, And a stranger passed not over into their midst:

20.text: ‘All days of the wicked he is paining himself, And few years have been laid up for the terrible one.

21.text: A fearful voice is in his ears, In peace doth a destroyer come to him.

22.text: He believeth not to return from darkness, And watched is he for the sword.

23.text: He is wandering for bread—‘Where is it?’ He hath known that ready at his hand Is a day of darkness.

24.text: Terrify him do adversity and distress, They prevail over him As a king ready for a boaster.

25.text: For he stretched out against God his hand, And against the Mighty he maketh himself mighty.

26.text: He runneth unto Him with a neck, With thick bosses of his shields.

27.text: For he hath covered his face with his fat, And maketh vigour over his confidence.

28.text: And he inhabiteth cities cut off, houses not dwelt in, That have been ready to become heaps.

29.text: He is not rich, nor doth his wealth rise, Nor doth he stretch out on earth their continuance.

30.text: He turneth not aside from darkness, His tender branch doth a flame dry up, And he turneth aside at the breath of His mouth!

31.text: Let him not put credence in vanity, He hath been deceived, For vanity is his recompence.

32.text: Not in his day is it completed, And his bending branch is not green.

33.text: He shaketh off as a vine his unripe fruit, And casteth off as an olive his blossom.

34.text: For the company of the profane is gloomy, And fire hath consumed tents of bribery.

35.text: To conceive misery, and to bear iniquity, Even their heart doth prepare deceit.
